sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination: 

5x + 2y - z = 10 

-3x - 5y + 2z = -8 

x + y + z = 6
message_2:
First, we will write the system of linear equations in the form of an augmented matrix:

```
|  5   2  -1 | 10
| -3  -5   2 |-8
|  1   1   1 | 6
```

Step 1: Swap Row 1 and Row 3 to have a 1 in the top left corner:

```
|  1   1   1 | 6
| -3  -5   2 |-8
|  5   2  -1 | 10
```

Step 2: Add 3 times Row 1 to Row 2 and -5 times Row 1 to Row 3 to eliminate the first element in Row 2 and Row 3:

```
|  1   1   1 |  6
|  0  -2   5 | 10
|  0  -3  -4 |-20
```

Step 3: Multiply Row 2 by -1/2 to get a 1 in the second element of Row 2:

```
|  1   1   1 |  6
|  0   1  -5/2 |-5
|  0  -3  -4 |-20
```

Step 4: Add -1 times Row 2 to Row 1 and 3 times Row 2 to Row 3 to eliminate the second element in Row 1 and Row 3:

```
|  1   0   7/2 | 11
|  0   1  -5/2 |-5
|  0   0  -11/2 |-35
```

Step 5: Multiply Row 3 by -2/11 to get a 1 in the third element of Row 3:

```
|  1   0   7/2 |  11
|  0   1  -5/2 | -5
|  0   0   1   |  10
```

Step 6: Add -7/2 times Row 3 to Row 1 and 5/2 times Row 3 to Row 2 to eliminate the third element in Row 1 and Row 2:

```
|  1   0   0 | -4
|  0   1   0 |  0
|  0   0   1 | 10
```

The solution to the system of linear equations is x = -4, y = 0, and z = 10.
